sentences.sContent: She also hopes her children will get a good education.
sentences.sCn: 她也希望她的孩子可以受到良好的教育。

sentences.sContent: efforts to improve girls’ access to education
sentences.sCn: 为增加女孩受教育机会所作的努力

sentences.sContent: ...That’s a big education in art by itself...
...Real-life experience is often more important than formal education for career success...
...With the44performance of American students in math and science has come increased competition from students from other countries that have strongly supported education in these areas...
...Thesecondis that our higher education system is not designed to focus on the economic consequences ofour students' years on campus...

...Parents and students who have invested heavily in higher education worry about graduates' job prospects as technological advances and changes in domestic and global markets transform professions in ways that reduce wages and cut jobs...
...employers have expressed a preference for students who have received a broadly-based education that has taught them to write well...
...and itis these basic qualities that education intends to cultivate...
...Those students who previously turned to urban schools for better education now are moving back to their local rural schools...
...Some simplistically attribute the decline in our public education system to the drain of skilled students by private schools...
...public schools provided far better education than private ones...

phrases.pCn: 高等教育（指含大学以上的教育）
远程教育；广播教育，函授教育
n. 初等教育，基本教育（指小学）

words.tran: 教育家；教育工作者；教师
训练；教导；培育（educate的过去分词形式）

trans.tranOther: the process of teaching and learning, usually at school, college, or university
